intro: Hexaptera constitutionis, commonly known as the constitutional hexaptery, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant exhibits a distinctive branching pattern with six primary branches, giving it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a pale yellow to greenish hue. Hexaptera constitutionis is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
